alert.note: Alert for San Diego (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued January 22 at 9:42AM PST until January 22 at 12:45PM PST by NWS SanDiego
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 1130 AM PST THIS MORNING FOR EASTERN VALLEYS AND COASTAL MOUNTAIN SLOPES IN SAN DIEGO COUNTY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by moderate to locally heavy rainfall is expected. * WHERE...For the eastern valleys and coastal mountain slopes in San Diego County. * WHEN...Until 1130 AM PST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 939 AM PST, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain. Areas of minor flooding have been reported in the advisory area. Between 0.5 and 0.75 inches of rain have fallen in the past 3 hours. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.25 to 0.5 inches, locally up to 0.75 inches, are expected over the area through the afternoon. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Ramona, Alpine, Julian, Cuyamaca Rancho State Park, Mount Laguna, Valley Center, I-8 Between Pine Valley And Boulevard, Fallbrook, Escondido and Hwy 78 Between Ramona And Santa Ysabel. - https://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
